post.body: Thanks! I will ask support for that patch. Wow -- post on Twitter, get response in 2 min. Submit via MC bug form, wait 4 days.
You can remove â€™ via a MySQL search and replace. See http://tinyurl.com/5ywx9g (8 and 9) and http://tinyurl.com/29y2vf.
Thanks for responding to my tweets so quickly and logging the bug.
I couldn't duplicate the prob. on your help file, but I could dup it with a brand new project. See video: http://tinyurl.com/3haq7xf
http://getsatisfaction.com is a great site. I'd seen it briefly before, but now I see a perfect use for it. Thanks.
Thanks for the quick response. I have no idea what the problem is, but I can duplicate it 100% of the time.
Oops, I meant 6, not 6.1. The flicker happens in the production video, so it's unnoticeable as you edit your project. Sneaks in.
I'm looking to interview someone for a podcast on tech writing in an agile environment. Can anyone recommend a person? (Based anywhere.)
Jane is making a Christmas letter by compiling her funniest tweets over the year, sorting them by category. Clever.
New podcast: "What Is the Technical Writer’s Role in Interface Design? Interview with Bogo Vatovec" http://tinyurl.com/6ogfhy Don't miss it.
At Mormon Tabernacle Choir event at the Conf Center (20,000 people here) but oh how I would have preferred the Jazz vs Orlando game instead.
Holy smokes! Soundsoap is a miracle tool for removing hums, hisses, crackles, and rumbles from audio. @harrymiller recommended it long ago.
Took the trampoline down, winterized the sprinklers, clearing space in the garage. Preparing for the forecast snow that so far hasn't come.
The next release notes I do will be a cool movie set to jazz, like this: http://tinyurl.com/5s6na7
Since upgrading to Flare 4.1, I've noticed that some cross ref links temporarily disappear in the WYSIWYG interface. Same for anyone else?
Sending 16 separate Flare topics for SME review -- sending them one by one. One ... by ... o-n-e.
Excellent podcast this morning with Bogo. Skype didn't give me any trouble; & Bogo's perspective was interesting, insightful, & relevant.
Tomorrow in the early a.m., I'm interviewing Bogo Vatovec for a podcast. I'm excited about it. It's been a while since the last podcast.
What's your favorite type of fruit smoothie? I absolutely love making these things. It's about all I ever do in the kitchen, unfortunately.
New post, "When Trust Becomes a Characteristic Flaw in a Project." http://tinyurl.com/6x4b5l
I wrote an article for Tech.lds.org titled "Twitter and LDS General Conference." http://tinyurl.com/65vwmf (It's about event hashtags.)
Lesson #1 as technical writer: Meet with the person you're writing documentation for -- the actual end-user, not just the SME.
Have you ever read James Hall's book of essays, titled "Hot Damn"? He's an exuberant writer who celebrates life -- esp in Florida.
Thought the monster project was over, and then business SME hands me 135 page internal procedures doc to integrate into 175 system manual.
pet peeve -- when someone higher up schedules a meeting right over top of another meeting on my calendar.
New post, "Writers see stories where others don't." http://tinyurl.com/6lvqnc
This new "Kids Play" feature on pbskids.com is awesome. Perfect content for pre-k kids.
Preparing some questions for a podcast on topic-based authoring. Can anyone suggest any good questions for me?
New post, "What I see -- James Hall's Essays and Florida" http://tinyurl.com/8vr48z
Feeling Christmas today -- my sister-in-law loaned us her treadmill; my neighbors helped shovel my driveway, Jane's been in a good mood.
Having a near perfect Saturday with the family. Cozy winter. Everything is ordinary, but marvelously ordinary.
Heading home early to avoid major snowstorm rolling through the Salt Lake valley. Prefer to finish work at home, not creep along highway.
Am wondering whether I should tweet all the bugs and problems I encounter with the software I use. Maybe it would speed up fixes. Good idea?
I don't know why, but I like the temperature (inside) to be about 7 or 8 degrees lower than almost every other human I've encountered.
Techsmith.com has better customer support than most software companies. You email them a question, & within a few hrs you have a response.
If you have Snagit, go to Help > Check for Upgrade. Besides new features (http://tinyurl.com/qlms4), they fixed a bug that was my pet peeve.
Anyone know how to insert a .swf file into a SharePoint blog post? SharePoint strips it out each time. Fruitless information on google.
Is it me, or is the interface for arranging a playlist in a Camtasia Theater project completely confusing? (I don't really want an answer.)
I meant to post this video link a while ago -- http://tinyurl.com/6mvkgw. It's a funny video about converting from analog to digital tv.
WordPress tip: If you upgrade to 2.7, disable the Kimili flash embed plugin (if you have it active); otherwise the visual editor breaks.
